title: Which countries were democracies in 1941? - Quora

response.answer_text: Not many. Most of the functioning democracies in Europe were under Nazi occupation and most of the rest were controlled by dictators. The only truly functional democracies still around in 1941 were the United States, Canada, Great Britain, Ireland, Sweden, Finland, Australia, New Zealand, and—nominally—South Africa. There may have been a few others, but for the most part democracies were far outnumbered by dictatorships, authoritarian regimes of all ilks, monarchies, or were under colonial rule (though often by Democratic nations such as England or France).

Which countries were democracies in 1941? The US, Mexico, Colombia, Venezuela, Chile, Uruguay, and Switzerland. Constitutional monarchies were the UK, Norway, Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Netherlands, Belgium, France. Good luck people.
